oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Town And Country Time - 1955-11-05 (copy 2) - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Radio program Town And Country Time, originally broadcast 1955-11-05 by WARL (Arlington, VA) - part 2. Special final broadcast of host Connie B. Gay, featuring in-studio and pre-recorded messages from various associates of Connie, including: Pick Temple; Charles Finley [last name unconfirmed]; Mark Evans and Billy Johnson of WTOP; Ernie Sparkman, Earl "Grandpappy" Davis, and Jimmy Oakes of Town And Country Time WTCR (Ashland, KY); James P. Davis of RCA records; Harry Berryhill, Annandale Volunteer Fire Department President; Jane Trimner, Connie's successor as Town And Country Time President; Hank Snow; Jimmy Dean and the Texas Wildcats (including Marvin Carroll, Herbie Jones, Buck Ryan, Bob Elliott, Smitty Erwin, and Dale Turner); Don Tucker of WTCS (Fairmont, WV) and Town and Country Time Vice-President; Dick Barr, WMCA (New York, NY) announcer and former WARL announcer; Sid Barbet of Buyers Associates; Ron Harrell [last name unconfirmed]; Johnny Shuto [last name unconfirmed]; Billy Grammer; "Fiddlin'" Curly Smith and Joe Brechner of WGAY (Silver Spring, MD); Byron Roudabush, Town And Country Time TV director; Murray Nash, President of Murray Nash Associates; Eddy Arnold; Bernie Harrison, writer for the Evening Star; Sam Jack Kaufman, president of the D.C. Federation of Musicians Local 161-710; Kilbourne Castell, former WARL owner; Fred Hand, manager of Constitution Hall; Fred Houwink, of WMAL-TV; Joe Wheeler of the Wheeler Brothers; Bob Keith; Ralph Case; Phil Long, Howard Fisher, and Don Owens, WARL DJs; George Crump, Commercial Manager of WARL; Ray Armand, manager of WARL; Cy Blumenthal, owner of WARL; June [Stuart/Stewart], of WTCR; George [last name unidentified]; Tom [last name unidentified], Town And Country Time Comptroller; George Rowe of the U.S. Department of Agriculture; John Anderson, Arlington Hospital Administrator; and Vince McMahon, promoter. Telegrams from Walter David Kilpatrick of Mercury Records; Mr and Mrs Everett Delozier; Representative Harold D. Cooley; Congressman Joel T. Broyhill; and Senator W. Kerr Scott are read during the program. Note: two sets of discs exist for this content, 'copy 2' is of higher audio quality.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins; Red Foley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Wildwood Flower (Chet Atkins) (recording) [continued from part 1] -- Connie B. Gay and Pick Temple talk -- Connie B. Gay introduces the next record -- Just A Closer Walk With Thee (Red Foley) (recording) -- Connie B. Gay introduces Charles Finley [last name unconfirmed] -- Charles Finley [last name unconfirmed] talks -- Connie B. Gay introduces the next record
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gay, Connie B. (Connie Barriot), 1914-1989; WARL (Radio station : Arlington, Va.); Town and country time (Radio program); Dean, Jimmy; Texas Wildcats (Musical group); Carroll, Marvin; Jones, Herbie, 1923-2001; Ryan, Buck; Erwin, Smitty; Turner, Dale (Vocalist); Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; Snow, Hank; Temple, Pick; Evans, Mark, 1917-1988; Johnson, Billy, 1925-2006; Sparkman, Ernest, 1925-2010; Davis, James P., -1963; Trimner, Jane; Grammer, Billy; Roudabush, Byron; Nash, Murray; Case, Ralph; Kaufman, Sam Jack; McMahon, Vincent J., 1914-1984; Kilpatrick, Walter David; Cooley, Harold D. (Harold Dunbar), 1897-1974; Broyhill, Joel T. (Joel Thomas), 1919-2006; Scott, William Kerr, 1896-1958
